meanings.definition: A dull finish on a surface, especially in painting or photography.
meanings.sent1: The artist preferred using mattes for his paintings to give them a subtle look.
meanings.sent2: The photographer used mattes to reduce glare and reflections in the picture.
meanings.sent3: The matte finish on the painting made it look more sophisticated.
meanings.sent4: The matte of the photograph muted the colors, creating a nostalgic feel.
meanings.sent5: The matte on the canvas absorbed the light, creating a soft, velvety texture.

meanings.definition: A border or frame placed around a picture or photograph.
meanings.sent1: The elegant matte around the portrait enhanced its beauty.
meanings.sent2: She chose a simple black matte for the photograph to make it stand out.
meanings.sent3: The ornate matte clashed with the modern artwork, creating a quirky effect.
meanings.sent4: The matte acted as a subtle guide, drawing the viewer's eye to the center of the image.
meanings.sent5: The intricate design of the matte added a touch of sophistication to the picture.

meanings.definition: To provide a protective covering for a surface.
meanings.sent1: He decided to mattes the table to prevent scratches and stains.
meanings.sent2: She carefully mattes the furniture to keep it looking new.
meanings.sent3: The children playfully helped matte the fragile glassware to avoid breakage.
meanings.sent4: The gardener mattes the delicate plants to shield them from harsh sunlight.
meanings.sent5: They quickly mattes the bookshelf before the paint could chip off.
